node.statement: HERGLOTZ COUPLING LEMMA (KEY HARD STEP): Prove J_p * J_q >= ||h||^4 using the Herglotz structure of omega_p, omega_q. The corrections alpha_i = sum_j m_j^p/(lambda_i - p_j^p)^3 and beta_i = sum_j m_j^q/(lambda_i - p_j^q)^3 arise from Herglotz representations omega_p(z) = z + c_p + sum_j m_j^p/(z - p_j^p). The constraint omega_p + omega_q = 2z + ... (from G_r = G_p(omega_p) = G_q(omega_q) and the additive structure of boxplus) couples alpha and beta. This coupling, combined with the Cauchy matrix structure of the corrections, should force J_p*J_q >= ||h||^4. APPROACH: Express J_p, J_q as quadratic forms in the Herglotz residues {m_j^p}, {m_j^q} and show the product satisfies the bound via Schur complement or matrix AM-GM.
